document_data.name: The Wizard's Hand
document_data.mainbody: '''The Wizard's Hand''' was an inn in the village of [[Maskyr's Eye]] in [[the Vast]] in the late 13{{th}} and 14{{th}} centuries [[DR]].{{Cite polyhedron/55/The Everwinking Eye: A Closer Look at Maskyr's Eye|24}} Although the only inn in the village,{{Cite polyhedron/57/The Everwinking Eye: At Home in Maskyr's Eye|21}} it was famous to travelers in the Vast, who thought to be among the three best inns to be found along the region's roads, It was named for the [[archmage]] [[Maskyr One-Eye]].
document_data.History: The inn was established some time around [[1277 DR]] by [[Riothar Orlsyr]]. This followed the burning down of a prior inn, [[The Three Dead Orcs]].
document_data.Location: It was situated beside the [[House of Plenty (Maskyr's Eye)|House of Plenty]], a temple to [[Chauntea]].
document_data.Structure: Constructed of stone and timber under a thatched roof, The Wizard's Hand was a low and sprawling structure.

Interior.Atmosphere: In the evenings in good weather, The Wizard's Hand taproom would fill with Maskyrvians, who met to drink and to hear news, [[clack]], and music from the travelers, [[adventurer]]s, and itinerant minstrels that passed through. If bidden, the Maskyrvians told their own stories of the area, sometimes growing quite exaggerated. [[Bard]]s were especially welcome, with audiences gladly giving coin for a ballad or dramatic story, despite how often it might've been heard before.{{Cite polyhedron/56/The Everwinking Eye: Adventures in Maskyr's Eye|26}}

document_data.Services:
As well as drinks of [[beer]], [[brambleberry wine]], [[sund]], and Mulmaster [[brandy]], a typical meal could include roast [[stag]] with [[wildsage stew|wildsage vegetable stew]]. For dessert, there was sweet [[tart]]s with [[brambleberry (berry)|brambleberry]] jelly and bowls of [[sugarbread]] soaked in brandy and coated in cream.

When [[dwarves]] journeyed out of the mountains and stayed in Maskyr's Eye to trade for around four days, two or three times a year, merchants from [[Mulmaster]] would rush to the village to trade with them. At these times, The Wizard's Hand would fill with guests, and the leftovers paid to stay at a local farm or camped by the road.

The village council also met in The Wizard's Hand, unless it was fill, in which case they went to the [[House of Plenty (Maskyr's Eye)|House of Plenty]], a temple to [[Chauntea]].
document_data.Inhabitants: In the late 1350s [[DR]], the proprietor and innkeeper was [[Lhullbannen Orlsyr]], son of Riothar. Although aided by his wife and four daughters, he was unwilling to leave the day-to-day business of the inn to them, expecting they wouldn't run it to his high standards.
